com.pdftools.pdf2pdf

Class Pdf2PdfAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pdftools.NativeLibrary
      • com.pdftools.pdf2pdf.Pdf2PdfAPI

  • public class Pdf2PdfAPI
extends NativeLibrary
    The purpose of the PDF to PDF/A Converter API is to convert PDF files to PDF/A-1b compliant files.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.pdftools.NativeLibrary

      • getEmbedT1asCFF

        public boolean getEmbedT1asCFF()
        Get option to convert Type1 (PostScript) fonts to Compact Font Format before embedding. This reduces the file size. This affects the embedding of fonts only, existing Type1 fonts of the input document will not be converted.

        Default: False.

      • setEmbedT1asCFF

        Set option to convert Type1 (PostScript) fonts to Compact Font Format before embedding. This reduces the file size. This affects the embedding of fonts only, existing Type1 fonts of the input document will not be converted.

        Default: False.

      • setOutputIntentProfile

        public boolean setOutputIntentProfile(java.lang.String strOutputIntentProfile)
        Set the path to the ICC profile for the output intent. An output intent profile is required for PDF/A compliance if an uncalibrated color space is used. If the document uses the DeviceRGB color space, an sRGB output intent shall be embedded. If the DeviceCMYK color space is used, a CMYK output intent shall be embedded. A PDF/A document shall not use multiple output intents.

        This method must be called prior to convert(). If the provided path is not a valid profile, the method fails.

      • getOutputIntentProfile

        public java.lang.String getOutputIntentProfile()
        Get the path to the ICC profile for the output intent. An output intent profile is required for PDF/A compliance if an uncalibrated color space is used. If the document uses the DeviceRGB color space, an sRGB output intent shall be embedded. If the DeviceCMYK color space is used, a CMYK output intent shall be embedded. A PDF/A document shall not use multiple output intents.

        This method must be called prior to convert(). If the provided path is not a valid profile, the method fails.

      • setColorSpaceProfile

        public boolean setColorSpaceProfile(java.lang.String strColorSpaceProfile)
        Set the path to the ICC profile for the color space of images. When no profile is defined DeviceRGB is used as default. This method must be called prior to convert(). If the provided path is not a valid profile, the method fails.

        Setting ICC profiles makes the converter substitute device color spaces with ICC based color spaces. At most three ICC profiles can be set, as substitutes for DeviceRGB, DeviceCMYK, and DeviceGray respectively. To set several ICC profiles, set this property several times. The matching device color space to be substituted is selected automatically.

        Note that it is not necessary to set ICC profiles for a successful conversion.

      • getColorSpaceProfile

        public java.lang.String getColorSpaceProfile()
        Get the path to the ICC profile for the color space of images. When no profile is defined DeviceRGB is used as default.

        Note that it is not necessary to set ICC profiles for a successful conversion. When getting this property, only one ICC profile file name can be queried: If the output intent is set to an RGB profile (a CMYK profile) then the file name of any set CMYK profile (RGB profile respectively) results. Otherwise anyset CMYK or RGB profile results with CMYK taking precedence.

        See also setColorSpaceProfile().

      • getImageQuality

        public int getImageQuality()
        Get the image quality index for images that use a prohibited lossy compression type and must be recompressed. Supported values are 1 to 100. A higher value means better visual quality at the cost of a larger file size. Recommended values range from 70 to 90.

        Default: 75.

      • setImageQuality

        public void setImageQuality(int iQuality)
        Set the image quality index for images that use a prohibited lossy compression type and must be recompressed. Supported values are 1 to 100. A higher value means better visual quality at the cost of a larger file size. Recommended values range from 70 to 90.

        Default: 75.

      • setAnalyzeOnly

        public void setAnalyzeOnly(boolean on)
        Set whether the input file is only analyzed. When set to true, the method convert() only analyzes the input file, it does not create an output file. The results of the analysis are written to the corresponding log file. If convert() returns True, the file is compliant.

      • getAnalyzeOnly

        public boolean getAnalyzeOnly()
        Get whether the input file is only analyzed. When set to true, the method convert() only analyzes the input file, it does not create an output file. The results of the analysis are written to the corresponding log file. If convert() returns True, the file is compliant.

      • setConvertAlways

        public void setConvertAlways(boolean on)
        Setting the property ConvertAlways to true forces the conversion even if the input file already conforms to the requested standard.

      • getConvertAlways

        public boolean getConvertAlways()
        Get whether the conversion is forced even if the input file already conforms to the requested standard.

      • getPostAnalyze

        public boolean getPostAnalyze()
        Get whether the created PDF output file is analysed and the specified compliance level verified. The result of this analysis is written to the log file.
        The post analysis is only executed if the conversion was successful. The property getPostAnalyze() is ignored if the property getAnalyzeOnly() is true.
        The post analysis can detect errors in the created output file that could not be predicted based on the analysis of the input file nor could they be detected during the conversion, because the conversion also depends on the input parameters (such as ICC profiles).
        The post-analysis is equal to the analysis using the 3-Heights PDF Validator and validating against PDF/A.

      • setPostAnalyze

        public void setPostAnalyze(boolean on)
        Set whether the created PDF output file is analysed and the specified compliance level verified. The result of this analysis is written to the log file.
        The post analysis is only executed if the conversion was successful. The property getPostAnalyze() is ignored if the property getAnalyzeOnly() is true.
        The post analysis can detect errors in the created output file that could not be predicted based on the analysis of the input file nor could they be detected during the conversion, because the conversion also depends on the input parameters (such as ICC profiles).
        The post-analysis is equal to the analysis using the 3-Heights PDF Validator and validating against PDF/A.

      • setReportDetails

        public void setReportDetails(boolean on)
        Define whether errors and warnings are reported in detail: Write a detailed list of errors and warnings from the analysis of the input file as well as the optional post-analysis of the output file to the log file.

        This option lists all conformance violations per page. Each violation is listed with a page number (page 0 = document level), error number, a description and a counter of how many times the error occurs. The option provides more detailed information than ReportSummary. All errors are listed in the header file bseerror.h. Here are a few examples of possible errors:
        0, 0x80410604, "The key Metadata is required but missing.", 1
        0, 0x80410604, "The key MarkInfo is required but missing.", 1
        1, 0x00418704, "The font Arial-BoldMT must be embedded.", 1
        1, 0x83410612, "The document does not conform to the requested standard." , 1

      • getReportDetails

        public boolean getReportDetails()
        Get whether errors and warnings are reported in detail: Write a detailed list of errors and warnings from the analysis of the input file as well as the optional post-analysis of the output file to the log file.

        This option lists all conformance violations per page. Each violation is listed with a page number (page 0 = document level), error number, a description and a counter of how many times the error occurs. The option provides more detailed information than ReportSummary. All errors are listed in the header file bseerror.h. Here are a few examples of possible errors:
        0, 0x80410604, "The key Metadata is required but missing.", 1
        0, 0x80410604, "The key MarkInfo is required but missing.", 1
        1, 0x00418704, "The font Arial-BoldMT must be embedded.", 1
        1, 0x83410612, "The document does not conform to the requested standard." , 1

      • setReportSummary

        public void setReportSummary(boolean on)
        Define whether errors and warnings are reported as a summary. Write a summary of errors and warnings from the analysis of the input file as well as the optional post-analysis of the output file to the log file. If any of the following violations is detected at least once, it is reported (once). This report provides less detailed information than the detailed list per page provided by setReportDetails.

        1. The file format (header, trailer, objects, xref, streams) is corrupted.
        2. The document doesn't conform to the PDF reference (missing required entries, wrong value types, etc.).
        3. The file is encrypted and the password was not provided.
        4. The document contains device-specific color spaces.
        5. The document contains illegal rendering hints (unknown intents, interpolation, transfer and halftone functions).
        6. The document contains alternate information (images).
        7. The document contains embedded PostScript code.
        8. The document contains references to external content (reference XObjects, file attachments, OPI).
        9. The document contains fonts without embedded font programs or encoding information (CMAPs).
        10. The document contains fonts without appropriate character to Unicode mapping information (ToUnicode maps).
        11. The document contains transparency.
        12. The document contains unknown annotation types.
        13. The document contains multimedia annotations (sound, movies).
        14. The document contains hidden, invisible, non-viewable or non-printable annotations.
        15. The document contains annotations or form fields with ambiguous or without appropriate appearances.
        16. The document contains actions types other than for navigation (launch, JavaScript, ResetForm, etc.).
        17. The document's meta data is either missing or inconsistent or corrupt.
        18. The document doesn't provide appropriate logical structure information.
        19. The document contains optional content (layers).

      • getReportSummary

        public boolean getReportSummary()
        Get whether errors and warnings are reported as a summary. Write a summary of errors and warnings from the analysis of the input file as well as the optional post-analysis of the output file to the log file. If any of the following violations is detected at least once, it is reported (once). This report provides less detailed information than the detailed list per page provided by setReportDetails.

        See setReportSummary(boolean).

      • setCompliance

        public void setCompliance(int compliance)
        Set the compliance level of the output PDF. Supported values for the enumeration TPDFCompliance are:
        - ePDFA1a --- PDF/A-1a
        - ePDFA1b --- PDF/A-1b
        - ePDFA1a --- PDF/A-2a
        - ePDFA1a --- PDF/A-2b
        - ePDFA1a --- PDF/A-2u
        - ePDFA1a --- PDF/A-3a
        - ePDFA1a --- PDF/A-3b
        - ePDFA1a --- PDF/A-3u
        Other listed entries (e.g. ePDF10, ePDF11... ePDF17 PDF, ePDFUnk unknown) are for other products and are irrelevant for the PDF to PDF/A converter.

      • getCompliance

        public int getCompliance()
        Get the compliance level of the output PDF.

        public boolean getAllowDowngrade()
        Get whether to allow automatic downgrades of the conformance level, e.g. from PDF/A-2a to PDF/A-2u

      • getConversionErrors

        public int getConversionErrors()
        Get errors that occurred during conversion. This property should be queried after convert or convertMem2 returned false and the property getErrorCode is set to PDF_E_CONVERSION.

        See NativeLibrary.CONVERSIONERROR for a complete list of possible values.

      • setConversionErrorMask

        public void setConversionErrorMask(int mask)
        Define which conversion operations shall result in a conversion error, i.e. set the return value of convert or convertMem2 to false and the property getErrorCode after the conversion to PDF_E_CONVERSION. In the case of a conversion error, use the property ConversionErrors to retrieve the actual errors of the conversion.

        See NativeLibrary.CONVERSIONERROR for a complete list of possible values. In order to accept all conversion errors, set ConversionErrorMask to ePDFConversionErrorNone.

      • getConversionErrorMask

        public int getConversionErrorMask()
        Get which conversion operations result in a conversion error, i.e. set the return value of convert or convertMem2 to false and the property getErrorCode after the conversion to PDF_E_CONVERSION. In the case of a conversion error, use the property ConversionErrors to retrieve the actual errors of the conversion.

        See NativeLibrary.CONVERSIONERROR for a complete list of possible values. In order to accept all conversion errors, set ConversionErrorMask to ePDFConversionErrorNone.

      • getFlattenSignatures

        public boolean getFlattenSignatures()
        Get option whether to remove all signed signature fields and add their appearances to the page's content. Note that the signatures themselves (the cryptographic parts) are removed and hence the bit ePDFConversionErrorDocSigned of the conversion error is set regardless of the value of the setFlattenSignatures property.

        Processing the PDF with 3-Heights PDF to PDF/A Converter API breaks existing signatures and their cryptographic parts need to be removed. In general, the visual appearances of signatures are regarded as worthless without the cryptographic part and are therefore removed by default as well. The visual appearances can be preserved by setting the property setFlattenSignatures(boolean) to True.

      • setFlattenSignatures

        public void setFlattenSignatures(boolean bFlattenSignatures)
        Set option to remove all signed signature fields and add their appearances to the page's content. Note that the signatures themselves (the cryptographic parts) are removed and hence the bit ePDFConversionErrorDocSigned of the conversion error is set regardless of the value of the setFlattenSignatures property.

        Processing the PDF with 3-Heights PDF to PDF/A Converter API breaks existing signatures and their cryptographic parts need to be removed. In general, the visual appearances of signatures are regarded as worthless without the cryptographic part and are therefore removed by default as well. The visual appearances can be preserved by setting this property setFlattenSignatures to True.

      • beginSession

        public boolean beginSession(java.lang.String strProvider)
        Begin a signature session. The methods beginSession and endSession support bulk digital signing by keeping the session to the security device (HSM, Token or Cryptographic Provider) open.
        For backwards compatibility the use of these methods is optional. If used, the Provider property may not be set. If omitted an individual session to the provider indicated by the property Provider is used for each signature operation.
        Parameters:
        strProvider - The provider string (see signature).
        Returns:
        true on success.

      • endSession

        public boolean endSession()
        End a signature session. The methods beginSession and endSession support bulk digital signing by keeping the session to the security device (HSM, Token or Cryptographic Provider) open. See beginSession.
        Returns:
        true on success.

      • setSessionPropertyString

        public boolean setSessionPropertyString(java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.String value)
        Configure the cryptographic session. The properties are provider-specific. Properties have to be set before starting the session and are deleted when terminating the session.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property.
        value - The value of the property.
        Returns:
        true on success.

      • setSessionPropertyBytes

        public boolean setSessionPropertyBytes(java.lang.String name,
                                       byte[] value)
        Configure the cryptographic session. The properties are provider-specific. Properties have to be set before starting the session and are deleted when terminating the session.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property.
        value - The value of the property.
        Returns:
        true on success.

      • testSession

        public boolean testSession()
        Test whether the session is still alive. If True: Subsequent calls to convert and convertMem2 are likely to succeed. If False: Subsequent calls to Convert and ConvertMem2 are unlikely to succeed. Error codes are the same as in Convert where applicable.
        Returns:
        true if the session is still alive.

      • getNoCache

        public boolean getNoCache()
        Get whether Cache for CRL and OCSP responses is disabled (true) or not (false).

        Using the cache is safe, since the responses are cached as long as they are valid only. The option affects both signature creation and validation.

      • setNoCache

        public void setNoCache(boolean bNoCache)
        Set property NoCache to true to disable Cache for CRL and OCSP responses.

        Using the cache is safe, since the responses are cached as long as they are valid only. The option affects both signature creation and validation.

      • addSignature

        public boolean addSignature(Signature sig)
        Add a digital signature to the document. The signature is defined using a Signature object. addSignature must be called prior to convert(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

        Do not dispose of the Signature object until the associated document has been saved or closed.

        Note: At this point it is not verified whether the certificate is valid or not. If an invalid certificate is provided the convert(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) function will fail later on.

        Returns:
        True: Signature could be successfully added to the document. False otherwise.

      • convert

        public boolean convert(java.lang.String strInputFileName,
                       java.lang.String strPassword,
                       java.lang.String strOutputFileName,
                       java.lang.String strLogFileName)
        Convert the input document (PDF) and save the output document (PDF/A) to a file.
        Possible problem causes are:
        - Device-specific color spaces for which an output intent does not exist
        - Missing font programs for non-embedded fonts
        - Missing metadata
        Parameters:
        strInputFileName - Path to the input pdf.
        strPassword - The password to open the input document
        strOutputFileName - Path to the output pdf.
        strLogFileName - Path to the log file.
        Returns:
        the result of the conversion. True: The file could successfully be processed. False: The file could not be converted. The correct error handling is described in the user manual.

      • convertMem

        public byte[][] convertMem(byte[] inputPdf,
                           java.lang.String strPassword)
        Deprecated. use convertMem2(byte[], String) instead

      • convertStream

        public boolean convertStream(Stream inputStream,
                             java.lang.String strPassword,
                             Stream outputStream,
                             Stream logStream)
        Convert the input document (PDF) and save the output document (PDF/A) to a stream.
        Possible problem causes are:
        - Device-specific color spaces for which an output intent does not exist
        - Missing font programs for non-embedded fonts
        - Missing metadata
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The stream to read the document from.
        strPassword - The password to open the input document
        outputStream - The stream to write the file to.
        logStream - The stream to write the log file to.
        Returns:
        the result of the conversion. True: The document could successfully be processed. False: The document could not be converted. The correct error handling is described in the user manual.

      • convertMem2

        public boolean convertMem2(byte[] inputPdf,
                           java.lang.String strPassword)
        Open a PDF document from memory, convert it to PDF/A and write the output document to a byte array. After calling this method, the pdf can be retrieved using getPDF() and the output log using getLog()
        Parameters:
        inputPdf - The input pdf as byte array
        strPassword - The password to open the input document
        Returns:
        the result of the conversion. True if the function was executed successfully, i.e. could read the input file and write an output file. The correctness of the resulting output file is reflected by the property getErrorCode().

      • getPDF

        public byte[] getPDF()
        Get the output pdf of the last in-memory conversion using convertMem2.
        Returns:
        the converted pdf document as byte array

      • getLog

        public byte[] getLog()
        Get the output log of the last in-memory conversion using convertMem2.
        Returns:
        the log file as byte array

      • setMetadata

        public boolean setMetadata(java.lang.String strFileName)
        Set the document's XMP metadata. The XMP metadata is inserted as is, which means it is not parsed and validated. If no XMP metadata is provided, the 3-Heights PDF to PDF/A Converter API generates it automatically.

      • setMetadataStream

        public boolean setMetadataStream(Stream stream)
        Set the document's XMP metadata. The XMP metadata is inserted as is, which means it is not parsed and validated. If no XMP metadata is provided, the 3-Heights PDF to PDF/A Converter API generates it automatically.

      • addFontDirectory

        public static boolean addFontDirectory(java.lang.String strFontDirectory)
        Add a path to a font to be embedded. Fonts must be embedded in order to create a valid PDF/A. If the input file contains a font which is not embedded, the font directory is searched for a font with the same name. If such a font is found, the font is embedded. This method can be used to add (multiple) font directories to the search path for fonts.

      • setInfoEntry

        public void setInfoEntry(java.lang.String sKey,
                         java.lang.String sValue)
        Add a key-value pair to the documents info object. Values of predefined keys are also stored in the XMP metadata package. Popular entries specified in the PDF Reference 1.7 and accepted by most PDF viewers are "Title", "Author", "Subject", "Creator" (sometimes referred to as Application) and "Producer" (sometimes referred to as PDFCreator).

      • getInfoEntry

        public java.lang.String getInfoEntry(java.lang.String sKey)
        Retrieve a key-value pair from the documents info object. Values of predefined keys are also stored in the XMP metadata package. Popular entries specified in the PDF Reference 1.7 and accepted by most PDF viewers are "Title", "Author", "Subject", "Creator" (sometimes referred to as Application) and "Producer" (sometimes referred to as PDFCreator).

      • setOCREngine

        public boolean setOCREngine(java.lang.String strEngine)
        Set the OCR engine that is used when OCR information shall be added during the conversion. If the engine's name is set to an empty string, OCR is not applied. A suitable OCR plugin is searched and loaded if the name matches.
        Parameters:
        strEngine - The name of the OCR Engine. For every available OCR engine, there is a corresponding OCR interface DLL. The OCR interface DLLs are distributed with the 3-Heights PDF to PDF/A Converter API and are required to communicate with the OCR engine. The names of all available OCR engines can be retrieved using the properties GetOCRPluginCount and GetOCRPluginName.

      • setOCRLanguages

        public boolean setOCRLanguages(java.lang.String strLanguages)
        Define a list of OCR languages that are passed to the engine.
        Setting languages helps the OCR engine to minimize errors by means of using dictionaries of the defined languages. This method must be called after SetOCREngine.
        If SetOCRParams is used, SetOCRLanguages must be called after SetOCRParams.
        Parameters:
        strLanguages - A string of one or multiple, comma-separated languages. The supported names depend on the OCR engine. The OCR engine will only use dictionaries of the set languages.

      • setOCRParams

        public boolean setOCRParams(java.lang.String strParams)
        Set a predefined or custom profile (i.e. configuration setting). By means of this method, OCR engine specific settings can be applied in the form of key-value pairs. These pairs depend on the OCR engine and are described in the corresponding manual.

      • getOCRPluginCount

        public int getOCRPluginCount()
        Returns the number of OCR engine plug-ins. OCR engines are accessed through the corresponding OCR interface DLLs.

        The OCR interface DLL is provided by the 3-Heights PDF to PDF/A Converter API.

        The OCR engine is provided as a separate product: 3-Heights OCR Enterprise Add-On.

        In order to make use of the OCR engine, the OCR interface DLL and the OCR engine must be installed. The property GetOCRPluginCount returns the number of available OCR interface DLLs. It does not verify the corresponding OCR engines are installed and can be initialized. The OCR engine is loaded with the method SetOCREngine.

      • getOCRPluginName

        public java.lang.String getOCRPluginName(int iPlugin)
        Returns the name of the i-th OCR engine plug-in. The number of OCR plug-ins is retrieved using i= GetOCRPluginCount.

      • getOCRReembedImages

        public boolean getOCRReembedImages()
        Specifies whether the deskewed images from the OCR engine should be reembedded.

        The OCR engine de-skews and de-noises the input image before recognizing the characters. This option controls whether the 3-Heights PDF to PDF/A Converter API should use the de-skewed image or keep the original image.

      • setOCRReembedImages

        public void setOCRReembedImages(boolean val)
        Specify whether the OCR engine should reembed the deskewed images.

        The OCR engine de-skews and de-noises the input image before recognizing the characters. This option controls whether the 3-Heights PDF to PDF/A Converter API should use the de-skewed image or keep the original image.

        Default value is 'true', the de-skewed and de-noised image from the OCR engine is embedded. This might change the appearance of the page. This setting is recommended for scanned documents.

        If this property is set to false, the original image is embedded. This setting is recommended for born-digital documents.

      • getOCRDeskewImage

        public boolean getOCRDeskewImage()
        Retrieve whether the original image and text are de-skewed according to the recognized skew angle (if OCRReembedImages is set to True only).

        If true, the image (and text) are rotated in the PDF, such that lines of text are made horizontal. This might change the appearance of the page. This setting is recommended for scanned documents.

        If false, the skew of the image (and text) is not changed. This setting is recommended for born-digital documents.

      • setOCRDeskewImage

        public void setOCRDeskewImage(boolean val)
        Specify whether the original image and text are de-skewed according to the recognized skew angle (if OCRReembedImages is set to True only).

        If true, the image (and text) are rotated in the PDF, such that lines of text are made horizontal. This might change the appearance of the page. This setting is recommended for scanned documents.

        If false, the skew of the image (and text) is not changed. This setting is recommended for born-digital documents.

        The default value for this property is 'true'.

      • getOCREmbedBarcodes

        public boolean getOCREmbedBarcodes()
        Get whether recognized barcodes are embedded in the XMP metadata.

      • setOCREmbedBarcodes

        public void setOCREmbedBarcodes(boolean val)
        Specify whether recognized barcodes are embedded in the XMP metadata. The default value for this property is 'false'.

      • getOCRRotatePage

        public boolean getOCRRotatePage()
        Rotate the PDF page according to the recognized orientation.

      • setOCRRotatePage

        public void setOCRRotatePage(boolean val)
        Rotate the PDF page according to the recognized orientation. The default value for this property is 'false'. If a page contains more than one image, the effect is undefined!

      • setOCRResolutionDPI

        public void setOCRResolutionDPI(float fDPI)
        Set the maximum DPI for OCR recognition. Resample images to target resolution before they are sent to the OCR engine. The default is 300 dpi, which is the preferred resolution for most OCR engines.

      • getOCRResolutionDPI

        public float getOCRResolutionDPI()
        Get the maximum DPI for OCR recognition.

      • setOCRThresholdDPI

        public void setOCRThresholdDPI(float fDPI)
        Set threshold DPI to trigger OCR downsampling. Only images with a higher resolution than the threshold are re-sampled before OCR. The default is 400 dpi. Set threshold to -1 to deactivate downsampling.

      • getOCRThresholdDPI

        public float getOCRThresholdDPI()
        Get threshold DPI to trigger OCR downsampling. Only images with a higher resolution than the threshold are re-sampled before OCR. The default is 400 dpi. If set to -1, downsampling is deactivated.

      • setOCRBitonalRecognition

        public void setOCRBitonalRecognition(boolean bBitonal)
        Set the option whether the images should be converted to bitonal before OCR recognition. For OCR engines optimized for bitonal images, this option leads to faster processing and better results. Enabling this feature automatically re-embeds the original images in the output document. The setting of the property setOCRReembedImages is therefore ignored.

      • getOCRBitonalRecognition

        public boolean getOCRBitonalRecognition()
        Get the option whether the images should be converted to bitonal before OCR recognition. For OCR engines optimized for bitonal images, this option leads to faster processing and better results. Enabling this feature automatically re-embeds the original images in the output document. The setting of the property setOCRReembedImages is therefore ignored.

      • setOCRMode

        public void setOCRMode(int mask)
        Specify the behavior of the converter for files with existing OCR text. Available OCR modes are the following:
        1: Only perform OCR for images without existing OCR text (default).
        2: If OCR engine is active, remove old OCR text and perform OCR for all images. Hence, existing OCR text is not removed if OCR engine is not active.
        3: Always remove old OCR text and, if OCR engine is active, perform OCR for all images. This can be used to strip existing, without adding new OCR text.
        4: Only perform OCR if the input file contains no text.

      • getOCRMode

        public int getOCRMode()
        Get the behavior of the converter for files with existing OCR text. Available OCR modes are the following:
        1: Only perform OCR for images without existing OCR text (default).
        2: If OCR engine is active, remove old OCR text and perform OCR for all images. Hence, existing OCR text is not removed if OCR engine is not active.
        3: Always remove old OCR text and, if OCR engine is active, perform OCR for all images. This can be used to strip existing, without adding new OCR text.
        4: Only perform OCR if the input file contains no text.

      • ExportText

        public boolean ExportText(java.lang.String file)
        Export the retrieved OCR text to a file. This function can only be used in combination with an OCR engine (see property setOCREngine). When an OCR engine is set, the OCR text is always embedded in the resulting PDF document. If this method is used, it is in addition also extracted to a file.

        The output format is a table, where rows are separated by a new line and columns are separated by a tabulator. The table contains the following columns:
        - Page - Page number
        - Image - PDF object number which contains the image
        - FontSize - Font size in points
        - FontName - Font name, for any barcode font the name is"Barcode". This value is onlyset if the font name is returned by the OCR engine.
        - FontFamily - 1: Serif, 2: SansSerif, 3: Monospaced. This value is only set if provided by the OCR engine.
        - FontStyles - 1: Barcode, 2: Bold, 4: Italic, 8: Underline, 16: Strikeout. This value is only set if provided by the OCR engine. Example: 6 = 2 + 4 =Bold + Italic.
        - Baseline - Baseline of the text.
        - Left, Top, Right, Bottom - Bounding box of the text in PDF coordinates
        - String - Recognized text

      • getLinearize

        public boolean getLinearize()
        Get whether the PDF is optimized for fast web access.

        Linearization is the process of preparing a PDF file in a way that permits random page access by a web browser. While the whole non-linearized PDF file must be downloaded before the first page can be displayed, this is not the case for a linearized file.

      • setLinearize

        public void setLinearize(boolean val)
        Specify whether the PDF should be linearized for fast web access.

        Linearization is the process of preparing a PDF file in a way that permits random page access by a web browser. While the whole non-linearized PDF file must be downloaded before the first page can be displayed, this is not the case for a linearized file.

        Default value is 'false'.

      • getTryConvertEmbPDF

        public boolean getTryConvertEmbPDF()
        Get whether to try to convert embedded PDF documents (PDF/A-3 only).

        Default value is 'false'.

      • setTryConvertEmbPDF

        public void setTryConvertEmbPDF(boolean val)
        Specify whether to try to convert embedded PDF documents (PDF/A-3 only).

      • addEmbeddedFile

        public boolean addEmbeddedFile(java.lang.String file,
                               java.lang.String name)
        Prepare the file for embedding. This is the same as AddAssociatedFile() with all arguments set to the default values.
        Parameters:
        file - The path of the file to be embedded
        name - The name used for the embedded file (default: FileName without path)

      • addAssociatedFile

        public boolean addAssociatedFile(java.lang.String file,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 int associate,
                                 java.lang.String afRelationship,
                                 java.lang.String mimeType,
                                 java.lang.String description,
                                 java.util.Date modDate)
        Add a file to the document's embedded files in convert. For PDF/A-3, the embedded file is associated with an object of the document, i.e. it is an associated file. This method must be called before Convert. The file is embedded as-is. Embedding files is not allowed for PDF/A-1 and restricted to PDF/A compliant files for PDF/A-2.
        Parameters:
        file - The path of the file to be embedded
        name - The name used for the embedded file (default: FileName without path)
        associate - The object to associated the file with (-1 for none, 0 for document, 1 - nPages for page), (default: 0 for PDF/A-3 and -1 otherwise)
        afRelationship - The relationship of the file to the object associated, PDF/A-3 only, (default: "Unspecified")
        mimeType - The mime type (default: "application/octet-stream")
        description - The description (default: "")
        modDate - The modify date (default: modify date of the file on the file system)

      • addAssociatedFileMem

        public boolean addAssociatedFileMem(byte[] file,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    int associate,
                                    java.lang.String afRelationship,
                                    java.lang.String mimeType,
                                    java.lang.String description,
                                    java.util.Date modDate)
        Add a file to the document's embedded files in convert. For PDF/A-3, the embedded file is associated with an object of the document, i.e. it is an associated file. This method must be called before Convert. The file is embedded as-is. Embedding files is not allowed for PDF/A-1 and restricted to PDF/A compliant files for PDF/A-2.
        Parameters:
        file - The memory buffer of the file to be embedded
        name - The name used for the embedded file (requried)
        associate - The object to associated the file with (-1 for none, 0 for document, 1 - nPages for page), (default: 0 for PDF/A-3 and -1 otherwise)
        afRelationship - The relationship of the file to the object associated, PDF/A-3 only, (default: "Unspecified")
        mimeType - The mime type (default: "application/octet-stream")
        description - The description (default: "")
        modDate - The modify date (default: current time)

      • addZUGFeRDXml

        public boolean addZUGFeRDXml(java.lang.String file)
        Deprecated. Use addInvoiceXml(int, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) instead
        Prepare the Factur-X or ZUGFeRD XML invoice file for embedding. This requires the compliance to be set to PDF/A-3. If the specified Factur-X or ZUGFeRD XML invoice file cannot be added during conversion, the conversion will fail with error PDF_E_INVOICEXML.
        Parameters:
        file - The path of the file to be embedded

      • addZUGFeRDXmlMem

        public boolean addZUGFeRDXmlMem(byte[] file)
        Deprecated. Use addInvoiceXmlMem(int, byte[], java.lang.String) instead
        Prepare the Factur-X or ZUGFeRD XML invoice file for embedding. This requires the compliance to be set to PDF/A-3. If the specified Factur-X or ZUGFeRD XML invoice file cannot be added during conversion, the conversion will fail with error PDF_E_INVOICEXML.
        Parameters:
        file - A byte array of the file to be embedded

      • addInvoiceXml

        public boolean addInvoiceXml(int type,
                             java.lang.String file,
                             java.lang.String afRelationship)
        Prepare the invoice XML file (Factur-X or ZUGFeRD) for embedding. This requires the compliance to be set to PDF/A-3. If the specified Factur-X or ZUGFeRD XML invoice file cannot be added during conversion, the conversion will fail with error PDF_E_INVOICEXML.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the invoice For the generic values ePDFInvoiceZugferd and ePDFInvoiceFacturX, the profile is determined automatically. If that's not possible, a profile can be chosen explicitly using the more specific enum values.
        file - The path of the file to be embedded
        afRelationship - Optional AFRelationship value The AFRelationship determines the relation of the invoice file to the PDF. Possible values are: "Data", "Source", "Alternative", "Supplement" or "Unspecified". Note that some invoice standards restrict the set of allowed values for certain profiles.

      • addInvoiceXmlMem

        public boolean addInvoiceXmlMem(int type,
                                byte[] file,
                                java.lang.String afRelationship)
        Prepare the invoice XML file (Factur-X or ZUGFeRD) for embedding. This requires the compliance to be set to PDF/A-3. If the specified Factur-X or ZUGFeRD XML invoice file cannot be added during conversion, the conversion will fail with error PDF_E_INVOICEXML.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the invoice For the generic values ePDFInvoiceZugferd and ePDFInvoiceFacturX, the profile is determined automatically. If that's not possible, a profile can be chosen explicitly using the more specific enum values.
        file - A byte array of the file to be embedded
        afRelationship - Optional AFRelationship value The AFRelationship determines the relation of the invoice file to the PDF. Possible values are: "Data", "Source", "Alternative", "Supplement" or "Unspecified". Note that some invoice standards restrict the set of allowed values for certain profiles.

      • getForceEmbeddingOfCMaps

        Get whether to force the embedding of predefined CMaps.

        Default value is 'false'.

      • setForceEmbeddingOfCMaps

        public void setForceEmbeddingOfCMaps(boolean val)
        Specify whether to force the embedding of predefined CMaps.

      • setToUnicodeFile

        public void setToUnicodeFile(java.lang.String file)
        Update the fonts' unicodes as specified by file. The file must contain the mapping of character codes to Unicodes for specific fonts.
